mouse

This module contains support to simulate mouse movements and clicks. For all functions that receives pos (or x, y) as parameter, wDefaultPoint or wDefault can be specified to indicate not to change.

The speed parameter is the speed to move the mouse in the range 1 (fastest) to 100 (slowest). A speed of 0 will move the mouse instantly.

Procs

proc getCursorPosition(): wPoint {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the current position of the mouse cursor. 
proc getCursorShape(): CursorShape {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the current mouse cursor shape. 
proc move(pos = wDefaultPoint; speed: range[0 .. 100] = 10) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves the mouse pointer to pos. 
proc move(x = wDefault; y = wDefault; speed: range[0 .. 100] = 10) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves the mouse pointer to (x, y). 
proc down(button: MouseButton = mbLeft) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Perform a mouse down event at the current mouse position. 
proc up(button: MouseButton = mbLeft) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Perform a mouse up event at the current mouse position. 
proc click(button: MouseButton = mbLeft; pos = wDefaultPoint; clicks = 1;
          speed: range[0 .. 100] = 10) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Perform a mouse click operation at the position pos. clicks is the number of times to click the mouse. 
proc click(button: MouseButton; x, y = wDefault; clicks = 1; speed: range[0 .. 100] = 10) {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Perform a mouse click operation at the position (x, y). clicks is the number of times to click the mouse. 
proc clickDrag(button: MouseButton = mbLeft; pos1, pos2 = wDefaultPoint;
              speed: range[0 .. 100] = 10) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Perform a mouse click and drag operation from pos1 to pos2. 
proc wheelUp(clicks = 1) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves the mouse wheel up. clicks is the number of times to move the wheel. 
proc wheelDown(clicks = 1) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Moves the mouse wheel down. clicks is the number of times to move the wheel.

Made with Nim.
